intro: Anisomeles heyneana, commonly known as the Mexican candleplant, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, candle-like inflorescences composed of numerous small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture, while its flowers are usually yellow or orange in color. Anisomeles heyneana is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in dry or rocky soils.
